2. Select any issue [preview on the right opens]

fields.description:
Our company uses SAFe and a rolling wave plan.  The teams are responsible for six sprints of groomed backlog.  Currently Sprint planning is cumbersome due to having to scroll from the backlog up through several planned sprints to move stories around and see the story point totals per sprint. 

It would be convenient if there was a toggle to enable a pane similar to the version and Epics pane when there are more than a couple of future sprints created.  This would allow teams to conveniently see how many story points are allocated and drag stories directly from the backlog to sprints in the same fashion as versions and Epics.  

I am attaching a screenshot to give you a visual of how it would allow teams to create kind of a sprint planning workspace and streamline the planning meetings.
fields.summary: create a future sprints pane on the agile board backlog view

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, when the board is configured with swinlane, the issues that match multiple swimlane will only be shown in the first swinlane they match. 

For example:
Swimlane: Queries
Q1: labels = A
Q2: labels = B

For issue X that has label: A and B, this will only be shown under Q1 swimlane, and not in Q2 swimlane. This limit the full view for the user to see the issues with label = B. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option where issues that match multiple swimlanes are shown in multiple swimlane.
fields.summary: Having the option to show issues in multiple swimlane

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is a crucial information missing in [Migrating JIRA applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-802592269.html] around different server timezone. Having different time zone between the source server and target server can break Agile reports due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a colored warning in the particular document and related document stating something similar to
{quote}
(!) Migrating to another server that has different timezone can break JIRA Software reporting. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433
{quote}

h3. Why this is important
It breaks JIRA Software reporting that is being used by Agile users. Representation of issues that are closed in a Sprint can vary.
 
h3. Workaround 
To re-run the XML restore that can take hours to complete, the full steps are explained in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-5433
fields.summary: Update Upgrade Documentation to WARN on Timezone

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi JIRA Team,

We have started using the Kanban board for our team but we noticed that the tickets continue to stay in the Done column forever. In order to mitigate this issue we implemented the following board filter which works great in clearing out the Board from issues which were released:
{code:java}
project in (<redacted>) AND (status != Done AND (fixVersion is EMPTY OR fixVersion != "Unreleasable Work")) OR (status = Done and fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() and fixVersion != "Unreleasable Work") ORDER BY Rank ASC, STATUS ASC

{code}
However, after we implemented this filter, I noticed that the Control Chart gets wiped with every release. I am assuming this is because the Control Chart uses the current state of the board filter and not keeping track of the boards history. Would it be possible to start storing the Control Chart data in a way which would take historical states into consideration? 

 

Alternatively, is there an alternative way for me to hide tickets from appearing in the Done column indefinitely and keep the Control Chart in-tact?

 

Thanks in advance for your response!
fields.summary: Add historic awareness to Control Chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At present, the only way to delete a repository from the DVCS connector is to delete the entire organisation it belongs to. For customers using a single organisation where not all repos are (or should) be used, this can potentially result in a lot of redundant data in the DB.

When a user clicks the 'x' in the UI for a repository today, it is "unlinked". Unlinked repositories still synchronise data in the background (see [SIN-236|https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/SIN-236] for proposed changes to that).

The DVCS connector should be updated to allow an admin to list all the "unlinked" repositories, and "really delete" the data for those.
fields.summary: Ability to delete a single repository

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At present, as soon as a repository is linked, a series of synchronisation tasks will be queued for that repository. These tasks will be processed indiscriminately until such time as that repo's data is completely sync'd with JIRA.

This can yield problems like in [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-49709], where there are some expensive repos that were unlinked some time ago that are still generating synchronisation tasks.

If a repository is actively synchronising while an admin unlinks the repository, all future synchronisation tasks for that repository should be paused until such time as the repository is re-linked.

This will serve two purposes:
 * help alleviate potentially expensive work that's blocking active repositories
 * give admins a sort of "soft killswitch" for stopping synchronisation tasks (today, they need to delete the entire organisation to stop a repo from syncing)
fields.summary: Synchronisation tasks should be paused or de-prioritised when unlinked

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If an admin synchronises dozens of repositories at a time, the messages table can fill up with hundreds of, if not thousands of entries for processing commits from a repository.

At the moment, whether the system is actively processing any repository information is a bit of a black box.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if the UI could inform the admin on the amount of work the DVCS connector is processing. This would help both admins and Atlassian Support triage problems with the connector where the system is so overloaded with work that the plugin appears to be doing nothing.
fields.summary: Indicate queue size for synchronisation tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a customer has a large number of repositories, or one significantly large repository with many branches, the messages table fills up with a lot of sync tasks for that repo. Other repositories' sync tasks can get pushed back as a result.

When a repo begins synchronisation, the UI is updated with a spinner and a message that implies the synchronisation is immediately processed.

In reality, that repo may not be actively synchronised for a little while.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be fantastic if the UI could inform when a synchronisation is queued versus actively being processed.

Achieving this may require adjusting of how a repository is considered to be syncing, which may involve database-level changes (since I think it assumes a sync is actively being processed if there's an entry in the audit log table with no end date).
fields.summary: Differentiate between repo syncs that are actively being processed versus queued

h3. Summary
Issue links in the Agile board's issue detail view do not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue link between the two issues;
# Access the issue detail view via a board;
# Click on the issue link;

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on the issue link should open the linked issue.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Notes
The link works in the default "View Issue" screen (when accessing the issue directly), but not in the board's issue detail view.

h3. Workaround
Right-click the issue link and click "Open" or "Open in a new tab/window". You may also use the keyboard shortcuts to do so, like 'Control/Command + Click' to open in a new tab or 'Shift + Click' to open in a new window.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When right clicking an issue in an Agile Board, the delete option appears even if a user does not have the Delete Issue permissions. If a non-privileged user chooses to delete, they get the following message:

 
{quote}It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new user.
 # Ensure that the user does not have Delete Issues permission for a project.
 # Navigate to an issue in that project, and select the More menu to verify that the delete option is not present.
 # Navigate to an Agile board.
 # Right click an issue, and notice that the Delete option is available.
 # Click Delete to get the error message above.

h3. Expected Results

No delete option will be available, similarly to how the More menu on the Issue View works.
h3. Actual Results

The delete option does appear, and throws an error when selected.
h5. Workaround

Update the announcement banner to hide the delete option on boards:
{code:java}
<style>
a#ghx-issue-ctx-action-delete {display:none} /* Removes delete issue option from Agile Board issue cards*/
</style>
{code}
 * This will hide the "Delete" option when right-clicking an issue on the Agile Board
 * Admins can still delete tickets by simply bringing up the "Issue Detail View" and clicking on the "..."
fields.summary: Delete Option Appears When Right Clicking Issue In Agile Board Without Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA 7.2.5 distribution does not install JIRA Software Application. This includes:
 * tar.gz installation package 
 * zip installation package 
 * linux 32 and 64 bit installers
 * windows installers

(!) upgrades via installers also corrupt JIRA Software Application the vanila 7.2.5 installer does.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download the 7.2.5 (.tar.gz version) [Download JIRA Software Server - Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download]
 # Install JIRA
 # open JIRA site after setup is complete,
 # navigate to Cog Icon -> Applications

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA Software application is installed and functioning
h3. Actual Results

The JIRA Software application is not installed yet. 
JIRA Core is installed, but not JIRA Software.

!725version.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Checked through catalina.out logs, but there do not appear to be any failed plugins to load. Hence the concern is that perhaps some component was not installed, or not included in the download package. Can't reproduce this with 7.2.4 and previous versions, so there must be something different about this release/version. 
h3. Workaround

After installing JIRA via installer, download and install JIRA Software directly from [JIRA Software - Version history|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application/versions]. The 7.2.4 version of JIRA Software is compatible with your existing JIRA 7.2 installation so this is safe to install.
fields.summary: Jira Software app not installing properly with the 7.2.5 distribution due to bad build

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7.2 we introduced [SOFTWARE REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.2.3]. JIRA doesn't support preflighted requests for CORS for new calls. 
There are problems here:
* JIRA doesn't add {{Access-Control-Allow_}}  headers to the request
* JIRA replies with *401 Unauthorized* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure CORS at JIRA for domain 'http://mysite.com'
# Fire the OPTIONS REST call with {{Origin}} and {{Access-Control-Request-Method}} headers. 
{code}
curl -v -X OPTIONS -H 'Access-Control-Request-Method: GET' -H 'Origin: http://mysite.com'  http://127.0.0.1:8081/rest/agile/1.0/board/1/epic
> Access-Control-Request-Method: GET
> Origin: http://mysite.com
{code}
Please note that performing certain types of cross-domain AJAX requests, modern browsers that support CORS will insert an extra "preflight" request to determine whether they have permission to perform the action. Eg. Firefox uses "preflight" request for methods other than GET, HEAD or POST. 

h3. Expected Results
Response has header with following content:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
< Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://mysite.com
< Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true
< Access-Control-Max-Age: 3600
< Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET
< Access-Control-Allow-Headers: X-Atlassian-Token, Content-Type
{code}

h3. Actual Results
JIRA replies with *401 Unauthorized* :
{noformat}
< HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
{noformat}

And this leads to error message in browser: 
* Cross-Origin Request Blocked: The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at <URL>. (Reason: CORS preflight channel did not succeed).
 
h3. Notes
If you remove *Origin* header call succeed, but CORS (Access-Control-Allow_ ) headers are not present:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v -X OPTIONS -H 'Access-Control-Request-Method: GET'  http://127.0.0.1:8081/rest/agile/1.0/board/1/epic
> Access-Control-Request-Method: GET


< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
< X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
< Allow: OPTIONS,HEAD,GET

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ... 
{code}

Please see specification for details: 
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Access_control_CORS
* http://www.w3.org/TR/access-control/#preflight-request

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA Software REST API doesn't support preflighted requests for CORS

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I want to know the velocity we actually achieved, even if a story that wasn't completed has its points value changed.

At present, a historical sprint report is affected by any later point changes which means you can't trust historic sprint reports for real achieved vs non-achieved points:
 * Instead after a sprint is closed, the values in the sprint report should become immutable (or have a separate function for manual editing if needed)
 * This could then be used in roadmapping tools like Portfolio to dynamically generate predicted velocity based on actual historical data
fields.summary: After closing a sprint, all story point values in the report should be locked - even if values are changed on issues themsleves

fields.description:
Hi,

  We have a JIRA instance ( [https://issues.jenkins-ci.org|https://issues.jenkins-ci.org/] ) where we tried to use the DVCS integration but sadly we had to stop it because it was consuming too many GitHub's APIs calls and thus we were hitting the rate limit.

  On JIRA side we have a project with 35k issues and on Github side we have more than 1500 repositories. We understand that we are probably touching a limitation and there are few JIRA users with such configuration but maybe you could allow to configure some caches or to configure the refresh rate to avoid such issue. We would prefer to have our DVCS info less up-to-date than none of them.

See also:
 * [http://lists.jenkins-ci.org/pipermail/jenkins-infra/2016-October/000893.html]
 * [http://lists.jenkins-ci.org/pipermail/jenkins-infra/2016-November/000960.html]
 * [https://twitter.com/aheritier/status/798583730730369025]

Best regards
fields.summary: DVCS integration for GitHub consumes too many requests

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-15214].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Importing from JIRA cloud to JIRA server 7.2.4 fails with error 'JIRA software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed'. 
h3. Environment

JIRA Server 7.2.X

JIRA Cloud 1000.555.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Get backup of cloud instance
 2. Install latest version of jira 7.2.4
 3. Run XML import which completes without error
h3. Expected Results

JIRA Software to work.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA Software is not available. Restart/reinstall is not helping.
h3. Workaround

Set or add a property "GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version" with value 51.
h3. Notes

The root cause is that Cloud export is missing GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version property which is required by Server. Maybe we are missing a downgrade task that should set the property to 51 which is the last SAL build number.

 

The symptoms are the same as in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-47764 but probably the root causes are different.
fields.summary: JIRA Software not working after Cloud to Server import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Velocity report include sprints from other boards. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.1.9 and 7.2.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Basically this might happen in the following scenario:
* You have Board A with filter "project = A". You have Sprint 1 with issue A-1, A-2 inside it. The Sprint 1 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.
* You have Board B with filter "project = B". You have Sprint 2 with issue B-1,B-2 inside it. The Sprint 2 has to be a future Sprint otherwise it correctly shows up in the report.

If issue A-1 is moved to Sprint B it means that Sprint B will contain 1 issue that match the filter of Board A, thus will make Sprint B APPEAR in board A. If that happen then the velocity report of board A will include Sprint B too. 

h3. Expected Results

Velocity Report should only show sprints from other boards if the issues were moved between active sprints, not in planning phase (between future sprints).
As moving issues to-from sprints affects velocity (committed/completed), the report should show it accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
* The chart include Sprint outside the scope of the board, and Sprint might result empty. 

!velocity.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Velocity Report Should Only Show Sprints Related To The Current Board

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
In some scenario, Scrum master needs to include additional issues in the sprint which must only be worked on after the main issues have been completed. At the moment, if the additional issues are added to the sprint after the sprint has been started will be marked as scope changes. If these additional issues are added since the beginning of the sprint being planned (together with other main issues), this will lead to other user mistakenly work on it before other main issues get completed.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the capability to add issues at the start of the sprint and for them to be clearly identified during the sprint that these are additional issues which have to be worked on after main issues are completed. In other word, I don’t want anyone to start working on these additional issues by mistake. The additional issues could either be labeled or shown/listed in a different pool or swimlane, but still in that sprint.
fields.summary: Having marker for issues within the sprint to indicate order of issues to work on

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the circumstance where a new issue type is introduced into JIRA, issues of that issue type may inadvertently be associated with existing Board filters which were not already configured to filter based on issue type.

In these circumstances, if the user does intend for that new issue type to enter the scope of these boards, they must manually modify each board filter to exclude these issue type(s), which can be a large effort depending on the number of boards which must be tweaked.


h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be beneficial in these situations to allow for a setting or configuration which globally blocks an issue type from appearing across all Boards.

Or, at the time of issue type creation, direct the user through a screen which either enables or disables that association with all of the boards in the instance that they have permissions to modify

h3. Workaround 

Retroactively modify all historical boards.
fields.summary: Allow for specific issue types to be globally excluded from all boards

fields.description:
Hello,

this is a feature request, as a spinoff of closed service desk issue:

[https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-227786]

We are integrating Github with JIRA cloud. As we follow the Git Flow development model, we find ourselves rebasing our feature branches on the `develop` branch daily. The obsolete (and unreachable) commits still show on the Git integration section on the issue. This is confusing, especially if the number of commits is large, and if the number of rebases is also large, as I end up seeing dozens and dozens of commits, instead of the real, "reachable" commits.

I have used JIRA (on-premise) integrated with on-premise Stash, and I am quite sure that we never had this issue.

The support engineer I spoke with in the linked service desk issue adviced me to overcome this by forcing a complete syncing. This works, but this is merely a workaround, as I have to do this all the time.

I would suggest enhancing your Github integration by implementing the same behaviour you are already providing when integrating with Stash (and presumably Bitbucket as well). I believe that it greatly degrades the integration you are providing.
fields.summary: Jira/Github integration - deleted commits still show

fields.description:
Hi,

[~klingsd1939976045] reported the following issue in our Ecosystem Developer ServiceDesk: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-69]

One of their add-ons has 2 workflow post functions, they show up normally when they try to use them in a JIRA Business or regular workflow. 

But if they use the Simplified Workflow from JIRA Software only one of them shows up. According to this documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/using-the-simplified-workflow-829056836.html] None of them should show up, as the Simplified Workflow doesn't support 3rd party add-ons.

Steven did some brute-force trail/error and found that the

<addable>ordinary,common</addable>

tag in the <workflow-function> clause in atlassian-plug.xml is the culprit.

Cheers,

Peter
fields.summary: Simplified Workflow shows some 3rd party post functions.

fields.description:
If you have the following:  
 * a scrum board that uses Story Points as the estimation statistic
 * you have Issues in a Sprint have Sub-Tasks with no Story Points estimate on them

JIRA will present a warning when you start the Sprint indicating your Sub Task issues have no esitmate on them.

This is a little strange since in Agile, backlog items are estimated at the Issue level, not the sub-task level.  Addtionally, JIRA Reports such as the Velocity Chart and Sprint Report don't seem to take into account the Story Points value on the Sub-Tasks.
fields.summary: Don't require Story Points value on Sub-Tasks when starting a Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes, after a workflow change, it is required to add the old status to the Board column mapping even though these statuses currently don't have any issues. This is required so that the reports (for example Cumulative Flow Diagram) are displayed correctly.

 

 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with workflow having statuses  'New', 'Allocated', 'Unallocated' and 'Reopened'. 'Done'
 # Create a Kanban board based on a project
 # Map 'To Do' column to all these statuses :'New', 'Allocated', 'Unallocated' and 'Reopened'.
 # View the CFD report
 # Now change the workflow and migrate 'Allocated', 'Unallocated' and 'Reopened' statuses into a single 'Open' state 
 # Map Open status to 'To Do'
 # Notice the report looks completely different now.
 # In order to get the historical data, you need to map 'New', 'Allocated', 'Unallocated' and 'Reopened' statuses to 'To Do'
 # However, when trying to do that, you get a warning by JIRA highlighting that these statuses do not have any issues.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should be smart to detect that these statuses are important to correctly reflect the historical data.
h3. Actual Results

You get a warning against the statuses  !warning.png|thumbnail!

 
h3.
fields.summary: Board configuration page gives warning for statuses that don't currently have issues even if they are required for historical data

fields.description:
Actual Result:

If User U is a member of group A. Group A is included in group B. I created a role "Watchers" in my project and put group B in it. Then, I added the role "Watchers" to the notification "issue created".

When user created a role "Watchers" in project and put group B in it. Then, user added the role "Watchers" to the notification "issue created".
It is expected that user "U" to receive a notification (since user U is a nested member), yet user U doesn't receive anything. Even the notification helper shows red icons everywhere.

Now, if user add group A to to the role "Watchers", then the user U receives the notification.

 

Expected Result:

As stated in here: [Managing Nested Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Managing+nested+groups]

User U should receive notification as Group B is sub-group of Group A.
fields.summary: Nested group members not receiving notification

fields.description:
+Issue Summary+

When a user focuses on an issue in the JIRA backlog, when the issue detail pops up, there are no options to allow the user to transition the issue.

+How to Replicate+

# Create a sample agile board with a few issues.
# Focus on an issue in the sprint to show the issue detail.
# Attempt to transition an issue or change the issue status.

+Expected Behavior+

fields.description:
h3. Description of problem:

JIRA Software 7.2.4 was released and is available to download when bundled with JIRA Core.
 * [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download]

JIRA Software 7.2.4 is not available on the marketplace.atlassian.com version history
 * [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application/versions]

h3. Impact:
 # JIRA UPM will not suggest an upgrade unless the version is present in MPAC.
 ** UPM currently suggests an upgrade to JIRA Core 7.2.4 but does not suggest that the JIRA Software application be updated to 7.2.4
 # Users will not be able to download the application files as an .obr.

h3. Expected results:

MPAC version history contains all versions of JIRA Software.

h3. Workaround: 

# Download the JIRA Software installer as a tar.gz
# Open the tar.gz and copy the contents of the following folder into your JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins folder
#* {{atlassian-jira-software-7.2.4.tar.gz\atlassian-jira-software-7.2.4.tar\atlassian-jira-software-7.2.4-standalone\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\application-installation\}}
#* When doing this you may remove the older version of the same plugins that you copy over.
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA Software 7.2.4 missing from MPAC version history

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Sprint Health gadget does sometimes record scope change correctly but sometimes not. 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Working case : 
 # Create a board from a project (example query : project = PQR AND issuetype = Story ORDER BY Rank ASC)
 # Create a Sprint (Example "Sprint 1")
 # Add (estimated)issues to the sprint
 # Start Sprint
 # Add the Sprint Health gadget to the dashboard. See the Sprint Scope change is reported as 0%
 # Add more (estimated)issues to the Sprint while it is running
 # Refresh the dashboard Sprint health gadget.
 # Notice it shows scope change 

Non working case : 
 # Create another board from same project (example query : project = PQR AND issuetype = Bug ORDER BY Rank ASC)
 # Right click on issues in the backlog and edit the issues to add the same Sprint from previous board "Sprint 1"
 # Now issues from the second board are added to the common Sprint from both boards
 # Add another Sprint Health gadget to the dashboard based on this board and the common Sprint
 # Notice that the Scope change is always zero.
 # Add more (estimated)issues to the Sprint
 # The dashboard gadget always shows scope change as zero.

 
h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Sprint Health gadget does not record scope change reliably

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA allows downgrading of backups on imports, however relies on downgrade tasks to be implemented. In JIRA Software 7.2 the LexoRank field is split into multiple fields and there is not a downgrade task for this. Due to that LexoRank will have problems if downgraded, for example Lexorank Integrity healthcheck fails even though the minimum and maximum markers are present and are correct in the database.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Generate a backup from any 7.2.x Server and restore it to 7.1.6 Server
h3. Expected Results

The LexoRank field should be downgraded back to the previous state, leading to the Lexorank integrity healthcheck status being normal and tasks working as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Lexorank integrity healthcheck fails as the {{BUCKET}} field is present.
 !healthcheck.png|thumbnail!

Maximum/minimum markers are present and correct in database. No duplicate marker values.
 !db.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the _atlassian-jira.log_ file:
{noformat}2016-10-27 20:47:16,978 http-nio-8080-exec-9 ERROR admin 1247x833x1 16ebkcn 00.000.000.000 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.a.g.service.lexorank.LexoRankIssueEventListener] Expected the first rank row to be of type MAXIMUM_MARKER_ROW. Found row[LexoRankRow{id=10000, fieldId=0, issueId=8, lockHash='9223372036854775807', lockTime=null, rank='null', type=MINIMUM_MARKER_ROW}]
com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankIntegrityException: Expected the first rank row to be of type MAXIMUM_MARKER_ROW. Found row[LexoRankRow{id=10000, fieldId=0, issueId=8, lockHash='9223372036854775807', lockTime=null, rank='null', type=MINIMUM_MARKER_ROW}]
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getMaximumMarkerRowAndPreviousRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:373)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially(LexoRankOperation.java:167)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.execute(LexoRankOperation.java:110)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankManagerImpl.performRankOperation(LexoRankManagerImpl.java:286)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankManagerImpl.getRankOrRankInitially(LexoRankManagerImpl.java:86)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankIssueEventListener.doOnIssueEvent(LexoRankIssueEventListener.java:43)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.AbstractIssueEventListener.onIssueEvent(AbstractIssueEventListener.java:38)
    ... 2 filtered{noformat}
 
or

{noformat}2016-11-17 16:06:30,172 lexorank-executor-thread-0 ERROR      [c.a.g.s.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancingService] org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Bad value for type int : 0|000000:
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Bad value for type int : 0|000000:
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.find(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:1236)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.findMinimumMarkerRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:263)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getMinimumMarkerRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.balanceFieldId(LexoRankBalancer.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankBalancer.balanceFieldIds(LexoRankBalancer.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.balance.LexoRankScheduledBalanceHandler.run(LexoRankScheduledBalanceHandler.java:60)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Bad value for type int : 0|000000:
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.toInt(AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.java:2747)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.getInt(AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.java:1991)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingResultSet.getInt(DelegatingResultSet.java:215)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingResultSet.getInt(DelegatingResultSet.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getLexoRankRows(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:1255){noformat}
 

 

Notice the values of the columns (in the error message) are not referring to the actual value shown in the database query output screenshot above: _id_, _fieldId_, _issueId_, _lockHash_, _lockTime_, _rank_ and _type_.
h3. Notes

When importing from a higher version the downgrade tasks are not executed on the data. We should either block importing or downgrade the field.
h3. Workaround

Take a database dump and remove the BUCKET column which is not supposed to exist in 7.1.x
 # Stop JIRA.
 # Execute the below:
{code}ALTER TABLE "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" DROP COLUMN "BUCKET";
{code}
 # Start JIRA
 # run the LexoRank integrity checks.
fields.summary: Lexorank Integrity Healthcheck Fails Due To "BUCKET" Column

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a Scrum-based software project (e.g. via the CYOA screen).
 # Go to the rapid board ([http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&projectKey=FOO)] or the backlog ([http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&projectKey=FOO&view=planning.nodetail)].

h3. Actual Result

The page title (shown above the sprint name or the word "Backlog") is "FOOTableau de", where "FOO" is the project key (see the attached screenshot {{dodgy-fr-title-in-fr-screen.png}}). This seems like a suspect translation, e.g. not even having a space between the project key and the word "Tableau". A native speaker should check this even with a space.

 
h3. Expected Result

The page title is shown in English.

 
h3. Notes

Interestingly, if you change the current user's language back to the default English, the dodgy French title remains even though the rest of the page is correctly in English (see the attached screenshot {{dodgy-fr-title-in-en-screen.png}}). Maybe that's a separate bug. This happens when you switch the user's language to German too, see the other screenshot.
fields.summary: Rapid board and backlog have suspect title in French

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Seeing a sprint that a story does not belong to in an Epic Burndown can be confusing. This is currently the [expected behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Epic+Burndown] when a story is closed outside a sprint's start and end date. However, it is difficult to determine where a story will go to if there are multiple Active Sprints start/end at around the same time.

h3. Suggested Solution
On Epic Burndown calculation, consider Sprint value as part of the formula.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown to consider Sprint value of a Story

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As of [JIRA Software 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+release+notes], when completing a Sprint, a popup will appear allowing the Admin to choose a Destination for Incomplete Issues if there are Sprints Scheduled.  By Default, the Backlog is Selected; in previous versions of JIRA Software (Agile), incomplete issues will be returned to the top of the backlog.
 !J64_backlog.png|thumbnail! 
Current behavior: If you complete a sprint and then return all incomplete issues to the backlog then they will return to the location in the backlog they were before the sprint started. This means if you dragged them from the bottom (if you just created them for example) then they'll return to the bottom.
 !J71_backlog.png|thumbnail! 

See related: [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Completing+a+sprint]

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.1+ 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and place it at the bottom of the backlog
# Create new Sprint
# Add newly created issue to the sprint
# Start Sprint
# Stop Sprint and choose to return issue to backlog

h3. Expected Results
Issue is placed at _top_ of the backlog

h3. Actual Results
Issue returns to the bottom of the backlog 

h3. Notes
Problem is not present in JIRA 6.4.x 

h3.Workaround
* Drag issues to the top of the backlog before adding them to your sprint.
* Create a future sprint and move incomplete issue there before closing the current sprint.
fields.summary: After closing a sprint incomplete issues doesn't return to the top of the backlog

fields.description:
Be able to have notes/comments on an Agile Board.  I see this working like this:
MVP: 
Have a notepad icon on the Agile board next to the Reports button.
When the user clicks on it a dialog pops up with the one large edit box and the ability to view or edit the text.
MVP+1:
Have the OPTION to limit the edit ability to just the Board owner/project admins
MVP+2:
When you hover over the icon, the text for the note appears.
MVP+3:
Have text field indicating the last user who edited the text and date of the edit.
MVP+4:
Make it work like a message stream where people can enter text and there is a stream of conversations that the user can scroll back through.  But still have a static, un-editable text field in addition to this that is editable by ONLY the Board owner/project admin. And have the ability for the user can use @notation to mention another user who will get an email with the text that was entered.  


Benefit:
This allows Board admins/creators to provide explanations about the use of the board, what the user is seeing, what the filters are for, notes that can be carried from
fields.summary: Be able to have notes/comments on an Agile Board

A project administrator is unable to perform bulk change in Boards as the user was not enabled in the global permission for bulk change. They are able to see the bulk change and choose the options but when clicking confirm they will see a 404 dead link error



How to Replicate

When they perform a bulk operation on the Kanban board (for sub-tasks),Choose the field to change and change the field and when they click "confirm" it comes up "404 dead link" error and does not process the bulk operation."

The ideal user story should be that if they are not able to perform bulk change they should see a permission error message instead of a 404 dead link error.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some reports (ie Velocity Report, Sprint Report) are not showing the correct data if the workflow is changed.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new Scrum project which will have 3 statuses (To Do, In Progress and Done)
# Create some issues, add some Story Points and create a new Sprint
# Add those issues in a Sprint and start it.
# Drag the issues to the right most column to complete it.
# Complete the Sprint
# Check on Velocity/Sprint report and data are showing correctly
#* Velocity report: Completed SP has some values in it
#* Sprint Report: Completed issues are in *Done* status
# Edit the workflow and remove *Done* status
# Add a new status in it (ie *Resolved*)
# Publish the workflow
# Go to the board's column configuration 
# Drag *Resolved* status to the right most column
# Drag *Done* status to _Unmapped column_ to remove it.
# Go back to the Report.

h3. Actual Result

- Velocity Report: Completed SP is changed to *0*
- Sprint Report: All the previously completed issues that were in *Done* status, are now changed to the previous status (ie. To Do or In Progress).

h3. Expected Result

- Velocity Report: Completed SP is still showing the old data. 
- Sprint Report: All completed issues are still with _Done_ or _Resolved_ status.
fields.summary: Some reports are not showing the correct data if the workflow is changed.

The issue seems to be only reproducible on a specific customer's backup and cannot be replicated on a newly exported Cloud backup.

h3. Environment
 * Oracle 12C database - using driver 12.0.0.1 on testing
 * JIRA Server 7.2.x

h3. Cause
The exception seems to be an Oracle-specific problem and is caused by differences in Cloud and Server version of DVCS plugin. The column {{FLIGHT_TIME_MS}} of table AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG uses data type {{INT}}, whereas Cloud uses {{LONG}}. It appears that Oracle cannot perform precision downgrade if the column is empty.

Additional information about changing size of a non-char column can be found in this [Oracle Administrator Guide article|http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e25494/tables.htm#ADMIN11661].

h3. Workaround
Run the below queries on JIRA's database.

(!) Make sure to have an up-to-date backup of the database before proceeding.

{code:sql}
ALTER TABLE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG
ADD FLIGHT_TIME_MS_TEMP NUMBER(11);

UPDATE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG
SET FLIGHT_TIME_MS_TEMP=FLIGHT_TIME_MS;

UPDATE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG
SET FLIGHT_TIME_MS = null;

ALTER TABLE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG MODIFY FLIGHT_TIME_MS NUMBER(11);

UPDATE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG
SET FLIGHT_TIME_MS = FLIGHT_TIME_MS_TEMP;

ALTER TABLE AO_E8B6CC_SYNC_AUDIT_LOG
DROP COLUMN FLIGHT_TIME_MS_TEMP;
{code}
fields.summary: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01440: column to be modified must be empty to decrease precision or scale
